text: What’s the status of running Julia in Google Colab? Where can I find the best instructions how to do it?

elements.text: What’s the status of running Julia in Google Colab? Where can I find the best instructions how to do it?

text: I think Pontus wrote something up on discourse some time ago. That's the last I remember

elements.text: I think Pontus wrote something up on discourse some time ago. That's the last I remember

text: I found this, but it’s a bit old <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/julia-on-google-colab-free-gpu-accelerated-shareable-notebooks/15319>

attachments.title: Julia on Google Colab: Free GPU-Accelerated Shareable Notebooks
attachments.text: (Disclosure: While I work for Google, this is not an official Google product or announcement.) tl;dr: For Julia on Colab with GPUs, first open this notebook and run the cell (takes ~15-20 minutes), then open this one to start using Julia. Recently, @denizyuret brought up on Slack that it would be nice if Google Colab supported Julia, especially for GPUs. I can’t promise anything about official or built-in support, but it turns out it’s possible to get this working entirely from the outside. ...
attachments.fallback: JuliaLang: Julia on Google Colab: Free GPU-Accelerated Shareable Notebooks

elements.text: I found this, but it’s a bit old

attachments.title: The notebook for reproducible research — Nextjournal
attachments.text: Runs anything you can put into a Docker container. Improve your workflow with polyglot notebooks, automatic versioning and real-time collaboration. Save time and money with on-demand provisioning, including GPU support. Use it for ML, data science, runnable tutorials, for your classroom or scientific publishing.
attachments.fallback: The notebook for reproducible research — Nextjournal
